page.title: 10"Bowcombe"_Local Issues 1
page.content: Not surprisingly; the main local issues reflect the differing interests of the farmers and other inhabitants and users of the countryside. From the farmers' point of view the most controversial issue is the use of footpaths over their land. Here there is a clear difference of opinion between the local Parish Council at Shorwell who want more footpaths, and the farmers who say that they experience more than enough trouble with the existing footpaths. The main problem is the leaving open of gates; a criticism which was strongly but reasonably expressed by all the farmers in the area. Furthermore, all those spoken to identified the principle culprits as horse riders and not walkers, though members of the local hunt clearly took care to avoid such carelessness.
